newsitem.title: DENMARK: Novo launches growth hormone in U.S..
newsitem.headline: Novo launches growth hormone in U.S..

text.p: Danish biotech group Novo Nordisk on Thursday announced the launch of its Norditropin human growth hormone in the United States.

A Novo statement said that the treatment, aimed at children with growing disorders, was approved by U.S. authorities in May 1995 but the launch was delayed by a patent row with rival U.S.-based Genentech.

The U.S. market for such drugs is estimated at $300 million but Novo said last month that it expected the introduction of Nordtropin there to have "a limited but positive effect on our American earnings."
Global sales of Nordtropin in 1995 amounted to 1.5 billion crowns, the statement said. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom +45 33969650
